item.name: Project Token

request.description:
Generate an onboarding URL for an individual person and pre-load the form with their personal data.
If you have the info, try to fill in as many fields as possible. This streamlines the onboarding process.

graphql.variables:
{
    "input": {
      "businessActivity": "Arts", 
      "businessActivityDescription": "I sell great art things", 
      "companyType": "Company", 
      "email": "myname@myartbusiness.com", 
      "isRegistered": false, 
      "language": "EN", 
      "monthlyPaymentVolume": "Between10000And50000", 
      "name": "My Art Business", 
      "redirectUrl": "{{CALLBACK_URL}}", 
      "registrationNumber": "123123", 
      "residencyAddress": {
        "addressLine1": "1 rue de la Paix", 
        "city": "Paris", 
        "country": "FRA", 
        "postalCode": "75002"
      }, 
      "ultimateBeneficialOwners": [
            {
                "individualFirstName": "Jean", 
                "individualLastName": "Doe", 
                "parentCompanyShareRatio": 10, 
                "reference": "456456", 
                "type": "DirectIndividual", 
                "parentCompanyReference": "234234", 
                "individualBirthDate": "01/01/1980"
            },
            {
                "companyName": "MyHolding", 
                "companyRegistrationNumber": "987654321", 
                "parentCompanyShareRatio": 90, 
                "reference": "12345", 
                "type": "DirectCompany", 
                "parentCompanyReference": "456456"
            },
            {
                "individualFirstName": "Pierre", 
                "individualLastName": "Paul", 
                "parentCompanyShareRatio": 100, 
                "reference": "9182746", 
                "type": "IndirectIndividual", 
                "parentCompanyReference": "12345", 
                "individualBirthDate": "01/01/1980"
            }
        ]
    }
}

request.description: Generate an onboarding URL for a company and pre-load the form with the company’s data. We highly recommend filling in all fields, especially Ultimate Beneficial Owners. The example below shows a company with one direct physical owner, and one indirect physical person through a direct company.
Keep track of your customer’s onboarding process. Once onboarding is done, keep track of the account holder that was created.
Make the most of your account details. This can be used to create a dashboard.
Add a new virtual IBAN to a given account. For this query, you'll need to add the account ID.

Keep track of all transactions whether Booked, Pending, or Rejected. A lot of this data can help you with reconciliation. In the case of incoming payments by virtual IBAN, you can retrieve the virtual IBAN ID.

item.description: The project access token is used when you act on your own behalf rather than on behalf of a user. To get a project access token, you have to use the OAuth2 flow (also called grant type): Client Credentials. Here are a few queries/mutations that may be useful as you get started with your integration. For more details, check out our documentation at https://docs.swan.io/",

item.name: User Token

request.description: Display user and account information, including account membership. If you want to provide a dashboard to your clients you should use this query.

Initiate one SEPA credit transfer. This generates a consentURL which redirects the user to approve the operation through Swan app.
Don't forget to replace the ACCOUNT_NUMBER variable.

You can make one consent request for multiple SEPA credit transfers - two in this example. This generates a consentURL which redirects the user to approve the operation through Swan app.
Don't forget to replace the ACCOUNT_NUMBER variable.
First, get a new access token using one of the above queries. Then, copy the refresh token and paste it in the body section of the User refresh token.
Add an account membership to a user using your account ID and the user's information.
Bind an invited user with the account membership. Don't forget to replace the TO_FILL_WITH_MEMBERSHIP_ID variable.
Add a new card to a Membership. To initiate this mutation, you must have canManageAccountMembership rights.
Get a card's ID and use the URL to display a preview of the card (like in an iFrame).
Get the consent URL to enable card number disclosure. The card number is displayed after the CardURL.

item.description: The User Access Token is used when you act on behalf of an individual user. To get a user access token, you have to use the OAuth2 flow (also called grant type): Authorization code. It's totally similar to how users log in to a web application using their Facebook or Google account. Here are a few queries/mutations that may be useful as you get started with your integration. For more details, check out our documentation at https://docs.swan.io/
